content.title: Journalist's Medical Welfare Scheme - Assam
content.beneficiary: Journalist and their dependent family members
content.details: In consideration of the long pending demands of the journalists in the State for their welfare etc. the State Govt. has considered to introduce a new scheme viz. “Journalist Medical Welfare Scheme” for financial assistance to the Accredited Journalist as identified by the Director of Information & Public Relations (DIPR) Assam under the Rule of the Assam Press Correspondents (Accredited/ Recognitions) Rules, 1989 for Medical treatment of such journalists who suffer from complicated ailments needing long-term, highly expensive treatment/involving the transplant of organs/complicated surgeries/long-term medical treatments, etc. Under this scheme, one-time financial assistance is provided to the accredited and recognized journalists of Assam for their medical treatment. This scheme covers the medical requirements of the journalist as well as their dependent family members.
benefits: One-time financial assistance for treatment to Accredited and Recognized Journalist of Assam.
Covers dependent family members of the journalist.
Financial assistance up to ₹ 50,000/- for non-life-threatening disorders and up to ₹ 1,00,000/- for life-threatening disorders.
eligibility: The applicant should be a citizen of India.
The applicant should be an ordinary resident of Assam.
The applicant must be a journalist who is formally accredited/recognised by the DIPR.
content.application_process: Application for grant of financial assistance shall be submitted to the Convener of the Committee (Director, DIPR) in the prescribed form, accompanied by a report in the prescribed format. Proposals for assistance will be initiated by the DIPR and scrutinized by the committee.
documents_required: Attested or self-attested copy of Identity Card (DIPR)
Bank details like Passbook (Front page) & Cancelled Cheque
Medical documents like Admission Certificates, Discharge Certificates, Prescriptions, Bills/Vouchers, Clinical Reports, etc.
A copy of PAN Card/Aadhar card
Other certificates and evidence regarding the current financial situation

faqs.question: What is the benefit of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this Scheme, one-time financial assistance is to be provided to the Accredited and Recognized Journalist of Assam for treatment.

faqs.question: Who can apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: A journalist of Assam who is formally accredited/recognized by the DIPR and fulfills all the norms required for the said accreditation/recognition.

faqs.question: How is the financial assistance extended?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance is extended out of the interest accrued from the Corpus fund.
